result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Purcell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Purcell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Matthew R Purcell in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Restorative Justice Program and Community Service hours have been completed.
Defendant has paid the $50.00 Diversion Court Fee.  Restitution has been paid in full.
State relates agreement terms have been fulfilled.
State moves to amend Count 2 to misdemeanor retail theft 943.50(1m)(b)(4)(a).  Court grants.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2 as amended.  Court accepts and finds Guilty.
State relates recommendation.  
Attorney Schlough relates recommendation.
Court relates and orders:
Court Costs.  60 days to pay or may set up payment plan.

Defendant Matthew R Purcell in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Diversion court fee paid and 1st restitution payment was paid today. Has been doing counseling. Attorney will contact the Restorative Justice programming.

1- Complete Restorative Justice Program.
2- Complete community service hours.
3- Make $50.00 Restitution payment by July 1, 2015.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew R Purcell in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant claims to be competent. Court finds the Defendant is competent and is able to proceed.
Diversion Court agreement filed. Must pay diversion court fee within 2 weeks.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew R Purcell in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense waives reading of information.
Defense's Motion for competency exam and relates;   Court orders a competency out patient exam with the WI Forensic Unit.
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Clerked by CS
15CF21: Defendant Alexis O Crabtree in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF22: Defendant Matthew R Purcell in court with attorney Scott Schlough. Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF23: Defendant Melissa L Purcell in court with attorney John O'Boyle. Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:46: Investigator Chad Thompson with the Rice Lake Police Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies all Defendants. 9:56: Cross by Attorney O'Boyle. 9:59: Cross by Attorney O'Hara. 10:01: Court questions witness. Court grants State 24 hrs to amend Complaints due to clerical error. Court finds probable cause on all cases and binds over for trial. 

Arraignments to be set on all cases by counsel.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must have no contact with the Rice Lake Walmart.
Must be fingerprinted by next Wednesday, February 18, 2015.

Defendant Matthew R Purcell in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant qualifies for PD representation. DOB amended to 5/24/90.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.
